description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eujii","text":"This protocol is to investigate the presence and localization of neurochemical markers in the submucosal and myenteric plexus of the porcine colon using immunhistochemical staining techniques. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"fa9ca","text":"samples of pocine colon","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8rem","text":"Krebs solution for preparation containing in (mM): 117 NaCl, 11 Glucose, 4.7 KCl, 1.2 MgCl2, 1.2 NaH2PO4, 25 NaHCO3, 2.5 CaCl2; Carl Roth GmbH \u0026 Co. KG (Karlsruhe, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":90,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":100,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":103,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":114,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":125,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e69nr","text":"Sylgard® 184; World Precision Instruments (Sarasota, FL, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l5ss","text":"4% paraformaldehyde; Sigma-Aldrich Chemie GmbH (Schnelldorf, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtkc2","text":"0.002% picric acid; Sigma-Aldrich Chemie GmbH (Schnelldorf, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hh9v","text":"0.1 mol/l phosphate buffer; Sigma-Aldrich Chemie GmbH (Schnelldorf, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fk2uo","text":"phosphate-buffered saline (PBS): H2O, Sodium Phosphate Monobasic, Sodium Phosphate Dibasic, NaCl; Sigma-Aldrich Chemie GmbH (Schnelldorf, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":34,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ge2e","text":"0.1% NaN3; Carl Roth GmbH \u0026 Co. KG (Karlsruhe, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":8,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4uat","text":"4% horse serum; Sigma-Aldrich Chemie GmbH (Schnelldorf, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jgel","text":"Triton X-100; Sigma-Aldrich Chemie GmbH (Schnelldorf, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ev3l1","text":"object slides; Gerhard Menzel B. V. \u0026 Co. KG (Braunschweig, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11np7","text":"glycerol; Sigma-Aldrich Chemie GmbH (Schnelldorf, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"874v2","text":"cover slips; Omnilab-Laborzentrum GmbH \u0026 Co. KG (Gehrden, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l4df","text":"all antibodies from table 1 and table 2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26vch","text":"epifluorescence microscope; Olympus Corporation (Hamburg, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oro5","text":"Olympus cellSens Standard Software, Olympus Corporation (Hamburg, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ft1kq","text":"Samples of colon were taken from apparently healthy pigs, placed in ice-cold oxygenated Krebs solution for preparation and immediately transferred to the laboratory. Tissues were then dissected in the ice-cold oxygenated Krebs solution for preparation to obtain whole-mount inner submucosal plexus or myenteric plexus preparations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmnvs","text":"The preparations were then incubated in PBS/NaN33/horse serum for 1h at room temperature followed by 12h and 2h incubation with the primary and secondary antibodies, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fh153","text":"Specimens were washed in PBS, mounted on object slides and cover slipped with a solution of PBS (pH 7.0)/NaN3 containing 65% glycerol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eon46","text":"The preparations were examined with an epifluorescence microscope equipped with appropriate filter blocks. Pictures were acquired with a camera connected to a computer and controlled by Olympus cellSens Standard Software. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4i53","text":"Tissue specimens were fixed overnight in a solution containing 4% paraformaldehyde and 0.002% picric acid in 0.1 mol/l phosphate buffer and then washed (3 x 10 min) in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Immunohistochemistry of porcine enteric neurons
